member.name: F:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.Interface
member.summary: The class that will be used to interface with the wifi module. This member will handle everything from initialization to joining networks.

member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.param: The mainboard socket that has the module plugged into it.

member.name: M:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.UseThisNetworkInterface
member.summary: Instructs the Mainboard to use this module for all network communication, and assigns the networking stack to this module.
member.remarks: This function is only needed if more than one network module is being used simultaneously. If not, this function should not be used.

member.name: P:Gadgeteer.Modules.GHIElectronics.WiFi_RS21.IsNetworkConnected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this WiFi module is wirelessly connected to a network device.

remarks.para: This property enables you to determine if the module is physically connected to a network device, such as a router. When this property is true, it does not necessarily mean that the network connection is usable. You must also check the property. returns true if the network connection is both connected and configured for Internet Proctocol (IP) communication tasks.
remarks.note: When is true, it does not necessarily mean that the network connection is functional. The IP configuration for the network connection may be invalid for the network that it is connected to.
